title: Remove rapidfire cannon’s “attacks cannot be dodged” and give it to Sword of the Divine
body:
Rapidfire cannon is already too strong, sword of the divine is already too weak by itself since phantom dancer singlehandedly makes it negate the champion that built it.

Sword of the divine would fit the thematic/need pretty well.

Alternatively give it to the cursed blade as an on hit/on spell debuff.

replies.body:
Putting it on Sword of the Divine would work, considering its other passive so rarely procs if ever.  It would certainly give it more of a presence for ADCs, considering it's made up of the two ADC items and yet is currently rarely (if ever) built.  That would mean Sword of the Divine would synergize really well with IE, but that requires 3 BFs, so I'm not too worried that would be spammed.

I also like the idea of moving it to Cursed Blade, but mostly because it's another of the super rare items, and they need to be buffed somehow.
Exactly. Neither of those two items really are that powerful innately. However rapidfire’s range and attack speed is already crazy powerful.

I would just make it that phantom dancer makes it so they cannot be crit on, aka crit autos that hit them turn into regular autos. 

I don’t feel like vayne is *that* op. I feel like she’s really bad for most of the game until she gets level 3 against other level 3’s. 

Speaking of true damage, what *does* need some sort of nerf is actually demons. The recent buff made them do crazy amounts of true damage. Doing 1/2/4 times the amount of mana burnt as true damage is insane considering some units get 150 mana, meaning demons can do up to 600 true damage on an auto while also stopping a spell from going through.

Completely being able to negate crit is absurd and PD most likely needs a nerf. I never build crit items anymore for that very reason. I don't think you could give an item 100% crit (essentially) while also making attacks undodgeable. It seems a little too overpowered in my opinion. I think RFC is fine but its build-path should maybe be different, though. You raise some good points and I'm sure that item balance and abilities is something that Riot is looking into.

Yeah it really is crazy that being able to negate crit is absurd, buuuut

Let me note that sword of the divine is actually rng based. Assuming the fight goes on for the full 30 seconds of a round, there’s a 21.4% chance it will not proc the whole round. Basically it’s a cherry on top item and not really a strong core item, and crits themselves don’t do that much more damage unless you have infinity/you are an assassin with synergy. 

I think that rapidfire cannon (or two recurve bows) building into the second best attack speed item while also making attacks undodgeable and giving ranged champions mapwide ranged while removing the intended weakness of melee champions is a liiiittle too much for one item.

Something that I am a big fan of after thinking on it is changing cursed blade (recurve+negatron) to have this passive instead. And instead of being passively on I think the undodgeable effect should be a debuff that procs off the cursed blade. Cursing them to be vulnerable.
